qas.question: Which administration called for investigation into the soundness of GSEs in the early and mid-2000s?
Who uncovered accounting discrepancies in Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac?

answers.text: Office of Federal Housing Enterprise Oversight (OFHEO)

qas.question: On what date did the House Financial Services Committee hold a hearing to assess safety and soundness issues regarding Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac?
What was the result of the House Financial Services Committee on September 10, 2003 regarding Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac?

answers.text: The hearings never resulted in new legislation or formal investigation

qas.question: Who rebuked OFHEO in 2003 for their attempt at regulation of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac?

context: In the early and mid-2000s, the <a0_0>Bush administration<a0_0/> called numerous times for investigation into the safety and soundness of the GSEs and their swelling portfolio of subprime mortgages. On <a2_0>September 10, 2003<a2_0/>, the <a4_0>House Financial Services Committee<a4_0/> held a hearing at the urging of the administration to assess safety and soundness issues and to review a recent report by the <a1_0>Office of Federal Housing Enterprise Oversight (OFHEO)<a1_0/> that had uncovered accounting discrepancies within the two entities. <a3_0>The hearings never resulted in new legislation or formal investigation<a3_0/> of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, as many of the committee members refused to accept the report and instead rebuked OFHEO for their attempt at regulation. Some believe this was an early warning to the systemic risk that the growing market in subprime mortgages posed to the U.S. financial system that went unheeded.
